body: Right, escaping the space (or quote the `-config` value) would be the way to go but the script is not taking that into account (yet).

issue.title: Parse -z arg as command line in Docker scripts

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Change Docker scripts to parse the -z argument as a command line, to
properly handle quotation and escaped characters, thus passing the
expected arguments to ZAP.

Fix #4332 - Struggling to Pass Authentication Header that contains space
(for API ZAP scan)

body:
Hi, I fixed it with the following workaround:

1. Generate token
```
ACCESS_TOKEN=YOUR_TOKEN_HERE
```
2. Store it in a props file (auth.prop) - 
```
BEARER_AUTH="Bearer "$ACCESS_TOKEN
echo $BEARER_AUTH

echo "----> Building prop file:"
echo  "replacer.full_list(0).description=auth1" >> auth.prop
echo  "replacer.full_list(0).enabled=true" >> auth.prop
echo  "replacer.full_list(0).matchtype=REQ_HEADER" >> auth.prop
echo  "replacer.full_list(0).matchstr=Authorization" >> auth.prop
echo  "replacer.full_list(0).regex=false" >> auth.prop
echo  "replacer.full_list(0).replacement=$BEARER_AUTH" >> auth.prop
```
3. call Zap
```
/zap-api-scan.py -z \"-configfile ./auth.prop"
```
Nice! Are you using the stable image?

I have been using -live and -weekly with the same result ...what is the problem ?

> On 19 Feb 2018, at 7:39 pm, thc202 <notifications@github.com> wrote:
> 
> Nice! Are you using stable image?
> 
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
>
That's odd, are you using the latest images? How are you escaping the header value?
I had the exact same issue as OP, I'm using the owasp/zap2docker-weekly image and escaping it with single quotes but it still doesn't work.
Could you provide the image ID?
I tried it with the zap2docker-live image, same issue. Image ID is 65d29d0ab1ef
Thanks, reopening, the fix is not working properly (while the args are correctly parsed, when passed to docker and then ZAP they are no longer interpreted correctly).

issue.title: Expand parameters double-quoted in zap-x.sh

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Change zap-x.sh script to expand the parameters double-quoted to pass
the parameters as is to ZAP.

Fix #4332 - Struggling to Pass Authentication Header that contains space
(for API ZAP scan)

body: Seems to be working for me now, thanks a lot for a very quick fix!
